hero.name: PRADUL P
hero.headline: Civil Engineer | BIM Explorer | Tech Learner
hero.tagline: I design and build in both the physical world (infrastructure, BIM) and the digital world (web apps, automations). I love turning everyday engineering workflows into smart, simple tools.
hero.status: Currently: Junior Engineer @ Paradigm  · Infopark Phase 2, Ernakulam
hero.openTo: Open to collaborations · BIM · Web tools · Automation

about.excerpt: Civil Engineer & BIM technologist integrating field experience with web tools and automation.
paragraphs: I'm a Civil Engineer, BIM Technologist, and web-focused problem solver exploring how digital tools, automation, and smart workflows can transform the way we design, coordinate, and execute projects.
I enjoy working with BIM tools (Revit, ACC, CAD) and exploring web development & automation—building utilities like BIM-related scripts that reduce repetitive work.
I'm focused on becoming a future-ready engineer who can combine civil engineering fundamentals with digital tools, automation, and efficient workflows.

whatIDo.title: BIM & CAD
items: Exploring BIM automation with tools like pyRevit & Dynamo

whatIDo.title: Web & Digital Tools
items: Simple web apps using React and JavaScript

points: Working on BIM-based modeling and detailing workflows for infrastructure projects.
Preparing and coordinating detailed CAD and Revit drawings for execution and documentation.
Involved in soil profiling, geotechnical drawings, and technical detailing based on site data.
Coordinating with design and site teams to align BIM models and drawings with on-ground execution.
Actively exploring workflow improvements using Revit, BIM standards, and structured documentation practices.
Led development and coordination of web-based projects using React and Tailwind CSS.
Managed small teams, assigned tasks, and ensured timely project delivery.
Solved technical and design challenges while maintaining project quality.
Gained hands-on experience in leadership, problem-solving, and modern frontend development workflows.

experience.role: Development of Parking Policy Framework for Kerala | Internship
experience.company: KSCSTE National Transportation Planning and Research Centre (NATPAC)
points: Conducted user opinion surveys to collect and analyze feedback from residents and commuters on parking facilities.
Performed land use surveys to study ownership patterns and identify potential parking infrastructure locations.
Executed parking in–out surveys to observe vehicle movement, parking duration, and utilization rates.
Contributed survey data and insights to the Development of Parking Policy Framework for Kerala project.
Prepared beam–column layouts and performed structural modeling and analysis using ETABS.
Worked on real project estimation using Estimax Pro for accurate cost assessment.
Prepared Bar Bending Schedules using Aadspro to support construction planning.
Practiced optimization of rebar consumption on construction sites using Optimax.

experience.role: Construction of Regulator Cum Bridge across Ummenchira River at Chekkupalam | Internship
experience.company: Kerala Irrigation Infrastructure Development Corporation Ltd (KIIDC)
points: Participated in the Construction of Regulator Cum Bridge across Ummenchira River at Chekkupalam.
Observed and assisted in construction techniques, quality control, and site coordination activities.
Worked with multidisciplinary teams to understand execution workflows and safety practices.
Enhanced understanding of professional ethics, site challenges, and industry standards.

experience.company: KSCSTE National Transportation Planning and Research Centre (NATPAC)
points: Collected traffic volume and vehicle classification data for selected roads leading to Muzhappilangad Beach.
Conducted on-field traffic surveys to capture peak-hour movement patterns.
Compiled and organized traffic data to support development planning studies.
Contributed to traffic survey and data compilation activities for regional road development.

education.place: St. Thomas College of Engineering & Technology, Sivapuram, Kannur
education.description: Completed undergraduate studies in Civil Engineering with a strong focus on structural fundamentals, construction practices, and digital modeling workflows. Final year project involved designing an energy-efficient college building using advanced BIM tools.
Completed higher secondary education in the science stream, building a strong foundation in mathematics and physics.

projects.title: ENERGY EFFICIENT COLLEGE BUILDING: INTEGRATING PLANNING, ANALYSIS, DESIGN, ENERGY OPTIMIZATION, AND ESTIMATION
projects.description: This project focused on designing an energy-efficient educational building using advanced BIM software tools. The comprehensive approach included site assessment, planning, analysis, design, energy optimization, estimation, and 3D visualization. Following the National Building Code and relevant IS codes, a G+2 educational institution was proposed demonstrating energy savings and sustainability.

innovation.title: Site Data → Digital Tools
innovation.description: I’m interested in converting raw site-level information (drawings, quantities, notes) into simple digital tools—like planners, trackers, and dashboards—to make daily work faster.

innovation.title: BIM Automation Ideas
innovation.description: Exploring ideas like parameter standardization, naming conventions, and quantity extraction using pyRevit/Dynamo to automate repetitive Revit tasks.

currently: Strengthening core BIM workflows in Revit.
Improving JavaScript & React skills for building better tools.
next: Create at least one small public tool or template that others can use.
Build a stronger portfolio of digital + engineering mini projects.

blog.title: Why I Care About Digital Tools as a Civil Engineer
blog.summary: A short reflection on how even simple tools like a money tracker or a Google Sheets workflow can save time in real projects.

blog.title: First Steps Into BIM & Revit Automation
blog.summary: Notes from my early experiments with Revit, pyRevit, and the idea of automating small repetitive tasks.
